newsitem.title: USA: MAPCO buys propane company to expand wholesales.
newsitem.headline: MAPCO buys propane company to expand wholesales.

text.p: MAPCO Inc announced Monday it has bought independent wholesale propane marketer Gas Supply Inc, a deal that will more than double the company's propane market base in the U.S.
MAPCO spokesman Rick Neal said the acquisition last week of the Minnesota-based company will increase MAPCO's wholesale base from 105 million gallons in 1996 to 225 million gallons in 1997.
Gas Supply Inc's market base was focused in the central and northeastern regions of the U.S.
"The Gas Supply Inc acquisition dramatically strengthens MAPCO's presence in the wholesale propane market..." company chief James E. Barnes said in a press release.

"It is a further example of our determination to establish a market-leading position in selected energy markets that have the potential to help double our earnings per share within five years," he added.
The company would not disclose terms of the deal.
MAPCO is a diverse energy group that has one of the largest operators of natural gas liquids and ammonia pipelines in the U.S.
In November, the company bought two retail propane concerns, bolstering its position as the fourth largest retail propane concern in the U.S.
